byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

abstract: Battle in Congress over National Security Agency's bulk collection of phone records is being waged among different Republican factions, with defense hawks squaring off against libertarians and new members clashing with old; Senate has been tasked with creating passable compromise bill, feat likely to prove challenging.
lead_paragraph: Unlike past partisan fights, the struggle over Patriot Act provisions on phone records, which is set to resume on Sunday, is an ideological battle pitting Republicans against one another.

headline.main: Battle Lines in G.O.P. Set Stage for Surveillance Vote
headline.print_headline: Battle Lines in G.O.P. Set Stage for Surveillance Vote

snippet: Unlike past partisan fights, the struggle over Patriot Act provisions on phone records, which is set to resume on Sunday, is an ideological battle pitting Republicans against one another.
